| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    | [Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line670](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line670 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c") |

A **caterwaul** is a new [feline](/wiki/Feline "Feline") in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"). It is twice as fast as an unhasted player, but is otherwise unextraordinary. Despite its name, it does not have any sort of noise-making abilities.

## Strategy

Caterwauls are extremely fast and have many attacks. However, their attacks do very nonthreatening amounts of damage, and with a decent armor class they are easily managed. [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth") can help, as usual.

## Origin

Yet another *[Dungeons & Dragons](/wiki/Dungeons_%26_Dragons "Dungeons & Dragons")* monster. It seems to be an original creation of *D\&D*.

It's a bipedal feline.
html:
Caterwaul

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
f caterwaul
Difficulty 8
Attacks Claw 1d4, Claw 1d4, Bite 1d6
f caterwaul
Difficulty 8
Attacks

Claw 1d4, Claw 1d4, Bite 1d6

Base level 6
Base experience 78
Speed 24
Base AC 4
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 300
Nutritional value 100
Size Medium
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

A caterwaul:

  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can be seen through infravision.
  • does not appear in Gehennom.
Reference Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line670

A caterwaul is a new feline in SLASH'EM. It is twice as fast as an unhasted player, but is otherwise unextraordinary. Despite its name, it does not have any sort of noise-making abilities.

Strategy

Caterwauls are extremely fast and have many attacks. However, their attacks do very nonthreatening amounts of damage, and with a decent armor class they are easily managed. Elbereth can help, as usual.

Origin

Yet another Dungeons & Dragons monster. It seems to be an original creation of D&D.

It's a bipedal feline.

A '''caterwaul''' is a new [[feline]] in [[SLASH'EM]].  It is twice as fast as an unhasted player, but is otherwise unextraordinary.  Despite its name, it does not have any sort of noise-making abilities.

==Strategy==

Caterwauls are extremely fast and have many attacks.  However, their attacks do very nonthreatening amounts of damage, and with a decent armor class they are easily managed. [[Elbereth]] can help, as usual.

==Origin==
Yet another ''[[Dungeons & Dragons]]'' monster. It seems to be an original creation of ''D&D''.

It's a bipedal feline.
